## Research Approach

We integrate [**artificial intelligence**](https://mcphersonlab.github.io/research/area/artificial-intelligence/) with [**classical experimental techniques**](https://mcphersonlab.github.io/research/area/classical-methods/) for [**drug discovery and development**](https://mcphersonlab.github.io/research/area/drug-development/) and other [**areas of research**](https://mcphersonlab.github.io/research). 
Check out a few of our publicly visible [**Ongoing projects**](https://mcphersonlab.github.io/research/projects) at the  [**Lab GitHub**](https://github.com/mcphersonlab), [**Zenodo**](https://zenodo.org/communities/mcphersonlab) or listed under [**publications**](https://mcphersonlab.github.io/publications/)

## Research Workflow

::: {#fig-project-workflow .center}
![A GitHub-Centered Workflow](research/flowchart.jpeg){width=70%}
:::


<!--- left align -->
:::{.text-left}
We use a **github-centered workflow** that utilizes:

- [Amazon Web Services (AWS)](https://aws.amazon.com/) (Cloud Computing)
- [Ubuntu Linux](https://ubuntu.com/) (Linux Operating System)
- [Docker](https://www.docker.com/) (Containerization)
- [Snakemake](https://snakemake.readthedocs.io/en/stable/) (Workflow Management)
- [VSCode](https://code.visualstudio.com/) (Code Editor)
- [RStudio Cloud](https://rstudio.cloud/) (Code Editor)
- [Jupyter Notebooks](https://jupyter.org/) on [Google Colab](https://colab.research.google.com/) (Code Editor)
- [Github](https://github.com) (Version Control)
- [Git](https://git-scm.com/) (Version Control)
- [Anaconda](https://anaconda.org/) (Package Management)
- [R Consortium](https://www.r-consortium.org/) (R Language Support)
- [Zenodo](https://zenodo.org/) (Data and Code Sharing)
- [LaTeX](https://www.latex-project.org/)and [Overleaf](https://www.overleaf.com/) (Publication Writing)
:::

## Texas-Powered Computing Resources
:::

<!--- center align -->
::: {#fig-project-workflow .center}
![Texas Advanced Computing Center](images/tacc.jpg){width=70%}
:::

<!--- left align -->
:::{.text-left}
[**Texas Advanced Computing Center (TACC)**](https://tacc.utexas.edu/): Computing resources utilized from by the TACC **high-performance computing (HPC) center** designed for *massive, compute-intensive workloads, large-scale data, and scientific workflows* that exceed what a laptop or small server can do.

Please reference TACC in any research report, journal or publication that requires citations.

**Suggested Citation**: 
*The authors acknowledge the Texas Advanced Computing Center (TACC) at The University of Texas at Austin for providing computational resources that have contributed to the research results reported within this paper. URL: http://www.tacc.utexas.edu*

**Minimum Citation**: 
*Texas Advanced Computing Center (TACC) The University of Texas at Austin*
:::
